intro: Borreria galapageia, commonly known as Galápagos borreria, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and woody stems. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the arid climate of the islands. Its leaves are often covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which helps reduce water loss. Borreria galapageia plays an important role in the local ecosystem, providing habitat and food for various insects and birds.
